content.description: Easier variation of Eyes Wide Shut that continues right into the juggy corner after turning the arete onto the face.
content.location: Same start as Eyes Wide Shut on small jug in the middle of the roof, near the back

content.description: Sit start in a finger crack in the corner and use a combination of laybacking the tapering crack and face crimps to gain juggy holds higher up the corner. Follow easy climbing in the corner to the top.
content.protection: Pads. Crux is low but landing is a little rocky.
content.location: Obvious crack in the overhanging corner

content.description: Sit start at a small jug in the middle of the roof. Climb through a larger jug under the roof before making a very long move over the lip to a sloper. Get your other hand over the lip and mantle on good slopers to the top out.
content.protection: Low roof over a flat slab, but you'll probably still want pads if you slip
content.location: Middle of the overhanging roof, where the roof is at its widest. Look for a line of two chalked jugs. This start is shared with problems that traverse out right from the roof to the arete.

content.description: Sit start on small jug in the middle of the overhanging roof. Move up to a larger jug. From there traverse out right on a line of crimps along the tier feature under the roof. Turn the arete onto the face, and follow the arete to the top while avoiding the corner to the right.
content.location: The smaller and further back small jug in the middle of the overhanging roof.

content.description: Sit start on two small crimps on the far right arete (right of the corner). Make a move to your choice of good slopers on the face, move around the arete to the face, and climb to the top through good edges and jugs.There's a rock just under the start position that is easy to dab, and even easier to dab if you pad it. Be careful not to slip off and bruise your ass if you forego the pad!
Sit start in the finger crack in the corner. Move out left at the first opportunity to crimps on the face and climb the arete to the left, avoiding the corner.
content.location: Obvious finger crack at the bottom of the overhanging corner

content.description: Large boulder by the river rich with holds on a steeply overhanging face and a dihedral that makes for a large variety of problems. A lot of good moves on this block, but it might not be the dryest or cleanest on any given day (like much of the rock in the park).
